body: @jbrockmendel : Good start here.  Needs a `whatsnew` + some testing (we have tests for checking the `ABC*`)

> Good start here. Needs a whatsnew + some testing (we have tests for checking the ABC*)

only the tests for the ABC are necessary. this is purely internal and doesn't require a whatsnew.

there *might* be a couple of places that you can use this in cython as well (in the .pyx).

Just pushed a commit with added tests.

> there might be a couple of places that you can use this in cython as well (in the .pyx).

Looks like it gets checked in period.pyx.  `_libs.period` already imports `tseries.frequencies` (which imports `tseries.offsets`), so replacing `DateOffset` with `ABCDateOffset` there wouldn't simplify the import structure.  That said, the downside is minimal if someone has a strong preference.

Related: for kicks I tried implementing `ABCDateOffset` in cython and found it made a non-trivial (relative) difference.  Instead of `isinstance(item, ABCDateOffset)` taking 2x as long as `isinstance(item, DateOffset)`, its closer to 1.1x.
this looks fine. needs a rebase.
